availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Larz Anderson (Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio attorney)

body.p: Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio attorney. Married to Catherine Longworth Anderson. Father of Nicholas Longworth Anderson, William Pope Anderson, Edward Lowell Anderson, Frederick Pope Anderson, Larz Anderson, Joseph L. Anderson, Charles Anderson. Graduate of Harvard University in 1822. Resident of Cincinnati in 1850. Attorney in Cincinnati in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Richard F. Miller, ed., States at War: A Reference Guide for Ohio in the Civil War, Vol. 5 (Lebanon: University Press of New England, 2015), 350.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 1, p. 37A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, 1st Ward Cincinnati, p. 52.
